intro: Odontites vernus subsp. himalayicus, commonly known as the Himalayan toothwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
